name: Business Development Manager (Marketing, gamedev)
description:
Have you always dreamed of doing what you love and enjoying your work every day? We invite you to the G5 Entertainment team! Let's develop and create better games together :)

G5 Entertainment AB is a Swedish mobile game publisher and developer. 20 years ago we became the first mobile developers in the CIS and since then we have been leading the game industry. We develop games in the genres of Match-3, Hidden Object, Mahjong Solitaire. Our portfolio includes 20+ world-class f2p projects, including Hidden City®, Jewels of Rome™, Mahjong Journey®, Homicide Squad®, Jewels of the Wild West™, etc.

We are looking for a candidate for the following position: Business Development Manager (remote).

(!) We are considering candidates exclusively from gamedev or with experience in mobile games.

What we expect:

  • Fluent spoken and written English and Russian (Advanced);
  • Experience in negotiating deals with Mobile Ad Networks;
  • Business Development experience across different regions (e.g. North America, Europe and Asia);
  • Experience of working with the international contracts;
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment;
  • Knowledge of the mobile gaming industry is a major plus.

What you are going to do:

  • Work across several functions including teams in marketing, business development, legal and finance;
  • End-to-end management of all partner relationships for the marketing department;
  • Screen new and existing department’s contacts/deals/agreements and seek better deals or new opportunities subject to the company’s goals;
  • Communicate with the key partners on a regular basis to strengthen existing relationships: arrange meetings, conference calls and regular correspondence by email;
  • Keep updated information on current accounts subject to the company's internal tracking means.

What we offer:

  • Work for a Swedish company with a portfolio of over 20 global free-to-play (F2P) projects that have been translated in 15 languages;
  • Participate in the full product development cycle;
  • Grow your career with an international company;
  • Official/contract employment;
  • Possibility of relocation;
  • Flexible working schedule;
  • Full benefits package;
  • Comprehensive, company-subsidized medical insurance;
  • Educational programs in English with highly qualified instructors;
  • Earn bonuses from project revenue for the teams you're involved in;
  • Performance share program for key employees;
  • R&D Project Development: opportunities for creating your own project within the framework of the company;
  • Paid conferences, trainings, and workshops;
  • Internal training platform (educational webinars for all specializations within the company);
  • Fun and educational hangouts/master classes;
  • Attend our annual internal TeamUp conferences abroad;
  • Participate in charity projects;
  • Free exercise classes.

Want to join our team and start developing games that are played by millions around the world? Then send us your CV and refresh your email more often so as not to miss the letter from our recruiter :)
